means: 改善( reform的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: A reformed party would have to win the approval of the people.
sentence.Network_cn: 一个革新的政党需要赢得人民的认可。

sentence.Network_en: Sunday trading laws will be reformed.
sentence.Network_cn: 星期日交易法将进行改革。
这个40岁的歌手重组了他的乐队。

化学专业英语_百度文库 ... polymerizing,polymerization 聚合 reforming 重整 purification 净化.

宗教改革运动(Reformation)，是16世纪在欧洲出现的以宗教改革为内容的大规模社会运动。中世纪后期的欧洲，教廷势力越来越大， …

entry.def: When an organization, group, or shape re-forms, or when someone re-forms it, it is created again after a period during which it did not exist or existed in a different form.

example.ex: The official trades union council voted to disband itself and re-form as a confederation...
example.tran: 这个官方的工会委员会投票决定解体然后重新组成联盟。
这个40岁的歌手重组了他的乐队。

means.word_mean: 1. caused to abandon an evil manner of living and follow a good one;
